title: Add scrollback support (scroll wheel + Shift+PageUp/Down)

title: Forward mouse events to terminal for TUI apps
description:
TUI apps (vim, htop, less, fzf) request mouse reporting via escape sequences. When the terminal is in mouse mode, mouse events should be forwarded as escape sequences instead of being used for text selection.
- Check Term.mode() for mouse reporting flags (SGR_MOUSE, MOUSE_REPORT_CLICK, etc.) before handling mouse events for selection.
- If mouse mode is active: encode mouse events as SGR escape sequences and write to bridge.
- SGR format: ESC[<button;col;row;M (press) or ESC[<button;col;row;m (release).
- This makes vim mouse mode, fzf clicking, etc. work properly.
- Mode flags need to be exposed in ClaideGridSnapshot.mode_flags or via a separate FFI call.

title: Window and session restoration on relaunch
description: Persist window positions, tab layouts, pane trees, working directories, and color schemes. Restore on app relaunch. Serialize PaneNode trees + metadata to disk. iTerm2 users consider this essential for recurring workflows.
close_reason: Session state saved on quit, restored on relaunch. Window frames, tab layouts, pane trees, and working directories persisted.

title: Render selection highlight in Metal shader
description:
Modify the grid snapshot and Metal rendering pipeline to highlight selected cells:
- Extend ClaideGridSnapshot to include per-cell selection flag (or a selection range struct). Per-cell flag (1 bit in ClaideCellData.flags) is simplest since Selection.to_range().contains(point) can be checked per cell during snapshot.
- In GridRenderer.update(), when a cell is selected, swap fg/bg colors (matching terminal convention) or blend with a selection color.
- Alternative: add a selection render pass in the Metal shader. Swapping fg/bg in the snapshot is simpler and matches iTerm2/Alacritty behavior.
close_reason: Selection highlight rendering via fg/bg swap

title: Expose selection API through Rust FFI
description:
Add C FFI functions to claide_terminal.h for selection management. alacritty_terminal already has Selection type with Simple/Block/Semantic/Lines modes, Term.selection field, and Term.selection_to_string(). Need to expose:
- claide_terminal_selection_start(handle, row, col, side, type) — create Selection
- claide_terminal_selection_update(handle, row, col, side) — update endpoint
- claide_terminal_selection_clear(handle) — clear selection
- claide_terminal_selection_text(handle) -> char* — extract selected text via Term.selection_to_string()
- Add selection range to ClaideGridSnapshot (start_row, start_col, end_row, end_col, is_block, has_selection) so the renderer knows which cells to highlight.
Side enum: Left=0, Right=1. Type enum: Simple=0, Block=1, Semantic=2, Lines=3.
close_reason: FFI functions implemented and building clean

title: Fix fuzzy text rendering on non-Retina displays
description: Text appears fuzzy on 1x (non-Retina) displays. Pre-existing issue — not caused by the R8 atlas migration. Likely causes: sub-pixel glyph positioning (fractional bearingX/bearingY), linear texture filtering blending adjacent texels when UVs don't align to texel centers. Potential fixes: snap glyph quads to integer pixel boundaries at 1x scale, or use nearest filtering when scale==1.0.
close_reason: Snap glyph positions to pixel boundaries via round(pos*scale)/scale

title: Implement copy/paste (Cmd+C, Cmd+V)
description:
Add clipboard integration:
- Cmd+C: if selection exists, call bridge.selectedText() and write to NSPasteboard.general. Clear selection after copy.
- Cmd+V: read NSPasteboard.general string, write to bridge (terminal input). Use bracketed paste mode if terminal supports it (check mode_flags for BRACKETED_PASTE).
- Bracketed paste: wrap pasted text in ESC[200~ ... ESC[201~ when the terminal has requested it.
- Hook into performKeyEquivalent for Cmd+C/V since they're key equivalents, not regular key events.
close_reason: Cmd+C/V implemented

title: Handle mouse events for text selection in MetalTerminalView
description:
Implement mouseDown/mouseDragged/mouseUp in MetalTerminalView for text selection:
- mouseDown: convert click point to grid (row, col, side) using atlas.cellWidth/cellHeight. Start Simple selection via bridge. Single click starts selection, double-click starts Semantic (word), triple-click starts Lines.
- mouseDragged: update selection endpoint, set needsRedraw.
- mouseUp: finalize selection (keep it visible until next click or text input).
- Coordinate conversion: pixel_x / cellWidth = col, pixel_y / cellHeight = row. Side = Left if within first half of cell, Right otherwise.
- Track click count with timestamp-based detection (NSEvent.clickCount handles this).
close_reason: Mouse events for selection implemented
